section.heading: Establishment of a healthcare training program.

para.text: By September 1, 2021, the WIC shall establish a healthcare training program ("program") to fund or arrange for training of District residents in a minimum of 2 healthcare occupations identified in the Partnership's first Healthcare Occupations Report, issued pursuant to § 32-1684(e), which may include one occupation for upskilling of incumbent workers.
To provide training, the WIC may:
Issue healthcare training grants ("grants") to train providers, pursuant to § 32-1603(c); or
Partner with the University of the District of Columbia Community College or Office of the State Superintendent of Education.
If the program includes a grant, subject to availability of funds, each grant shall be for not less than $100,000 per year for 3 years to provide training for District residents.
To be eligible for a grant, a grantee shall:
Be licensed by the Higher Education Licensure Commission as a post-secondary institution, degree or non-degree seeking;
Agree to utilize the training curricula recommended by the Partnership pursuant to § 32-1684(e)(5); and
Demonstrate consistent successful attainment of the following benchmarks for its training participants:
Unsubsidized employment in the occupation of training; and
Retention of employment for 6 months or longer in the occupation of training.
Preference shall be given to grant applicants utilizing an integrated education and training model, as defined 34 C.F.R. § 463.35.
The WIC shall utilize WIOA common performance measures to track program performance.
The WIC shall report on the performance of the program as required by § 32-1622.
The WIC shall make its best effort to use WIOA Title I funds to issue any grants authorized in this section.
